result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 9:49 a.m.  ADA Minser states there is a resolution in this matter. Requesting a continuance for a couple weeks. Jury trial on November 16, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF269 and 14CF325:
CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Amber Hahn  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Michael Wayne Smithey appeared. Case called at 2:38 p.m. Court reviews file. DA's office requesting a continuance on the jury trial. Atty Kucinski states that he was provided with criminal record and 2 discs by ADA Hahn today. Requesting records of the CI. May be called as witnesses. Also sent a request to Investigator Shepler with no reply. No briefs in the file. ADA Hahn states a hand written motion was filed with 14CF269 listed. Court was not prepared to address the discovery issue today. ADA Hahn believes that some of the items Atty Kucinski is requesting does not exist. Other items are in Pierce County. Atty Kucinski gives argument that briefs should have been written or police reports should have been filed on the controlled buys. ADA Hahn states that Atty Kucinski can put in an open records request to Pierce County. Atty Kucinski gives argument. Court reviews the discovery statute and doesn't see any requirement that this DA's office has to produce the records that Atty Kucinski is requesting. ADA Hahn gives factual information regarding confidential informants. Court at this time is going to deny the motion request at this time filed by the defense counsel in accordance to the discovery statute. ADA Hahn is going to file amended information today joining the 14CF325 and 14CF269. Court has previously ordered a formal joinder of these cases on December 19, 2014. No objection by Atty Kucinski. Court at this time will receive the amended information. Atty Kucinski is objecting to the request by the state to continue the jury trial. ADA Hahn gives argument. Speedy trial has not been demanded on either of these files. Court will grant continuance and will reschedule. Atty Kucinski demanding a speedy trial but consents to the dates set in November. Have additional motions filed by October 12, 2015.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty Kucinski. km
Opposing Continuance of 7/13/2015 - 7/14/2015 Jury Trial. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km

Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
* Defendant to report for prints and mugs. 

*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Corie Young.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
